title: I have a CDFTA or CDTFA LIEN/levy. They are harassing me. Can I go bankrupt?
question: The CDFTA CDTFA COMPUTER CRASHED in 2018-2019. They lost my appeal paperwork and amended tax returns. Can I go bankrupt and have them prove-up their case in BK court? I will ask to have lien removed upon resolution.
answers:
Whether sales taxes are dischargeable in bankruptcy depends on numerous factors, including when the taxes were actually assessed against you as a responsible party (must be at least 240 days prior).

It also must be more than 3 years since the last tax returns were due to be filed, and all required tax returns must have been filed at least 2 years prior to filing the bankruptcy case.

If they have a lien against any property, the lien will remain regardless of any discharge in bankruptcy.

My article on sales tax dischargeability in California may be helpful to you: https://www.bklaw.com/bankruptcy-blog/2015/03/sales-taxes-california-bankruptcy-cases-dischargeable/

Ultimately, you need to have a consultation with a qualified bankruptcy attorney to determine your options and find out what can be done in your situation.
